ai.summary: Mowbray Way is a challenging long-distance hike in the UK, covering about 39.1 km. The route traverses varied countryside and rural paths, demanding fitness, navigational awareness, and sturdy gear.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain: rural tracks, field edges, hedges, and occasional gentle to steep ascents. Expect muddy sections after rain, stiles, and exposed sections in high winds.
ai.safety_notes: Plan around daylight hours and weather; carry a map and compass (or GPS); let someone know your route and expected finish time; wear sturdy boots and clothing appropriate for the conditions; stay hydrated and carry extra food and an emergency plan.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April to October); winter can be tough with limited daylight and more severe weather.

seo.title: Mowbray Way Hike – 39.1 km Hard Route in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan your Mowbray Way hike, a 39.1 km challenging long-distance route in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and recommended gear.
